data.title: The Godfather Part II (1974) US One Sheet Poster
data.meta_description: Godfather 2 is widely considered the greatest film sequel of all time. Two storylines run through the film, Vito Corleone's (Robert De Niro) arrival in the United States in 1901 and Michael Corleone's (Al Pacino) attempt to expand the family business in the late 1950s. The earlier scenes are set in New York City while the later scenes are filmed at the Corleone family home in Lake Tahoe and a pre-Communist Cuba. This US One Sheet poster is from the films first release and includes the classic Godfather image of the puppeteer pulling strings. The font style has been widely copied by 'The Sopranos' and 'Snoop Dog' amongst others. The folder is in very fine folded condition. n nThe round white/black objects you may see in the corners are magnets, used to photograph the posters. They have not damaged the posters in any way.
data.text:
For full information on how we grade our posters please

read our cinema poster grading system article.

Below is a section from that guide:

Mint

A flawless poster that will be in the exact same condition as the day it was printed with no marks or fading.

Near Mint

This poster will be in excellent conditions and if it has a blemish or mark it will be barely noticeable.

Very Fine

A poster that may have more than one very minor flaws, a minor tear or some barely visible signs of restoration. Colour in outstanding condition.

Fine

A fine poster while still very presentable may have some edge damage, show clearer signs of restoration or have multiple nicks to the surface. If a folded poster there may be loss of colour along the folds.

Very Good

An average poster that shows multiple pinholes, tears that are clearly visible or possible tape stains. Colours are still good but the paper may have yellowed.

Good and Below Good

This poster will show serious signs of wear and tears, fading of colours, tear marks and/or noticeable repair work.

After searching for a while for an original cinema poster to make a statement on our hallway staircase wall, I started the search and found the Cinema Poster Gallery had just what I wanted.

As the poster was huge, I emailed to ask advice about framing before I considered buying.

I received a lovely friendly email back from Owen, giving me some advise and a suggested framers to try, which was very helpful â€“ with no push to purchase at all.

Makes a lovely change to receive such a personalised response and it made all the difference.

Poster received well packaged with a certificate of authenticity to confirm it was an original cinema poster, folded, in excellent condition.

Many thanks for your help, and best of luck for your business, you certainly have stood out from the crowd.

many thanks

Claire
